title: Spicy Mayo (Sushi Sauce)
directions: Combine mayo and sriracha in a small bowl.
Mix until fully combined and the color is uniform.
Taste and adjust sriracha for desired heat level.
Optionally add a tiny squeeze of lemon juice or rice vinegar for brightness.
notes: Kewpie mayo is preferred for its richer, tangier flavor, but regular mayo works fine. This sauce can be drizzled on sushi rolls or used to lightly toss diced salmon for a spicy salmon filling. Makes enough for multiple rolls. This one sauce alone will make homemade sushi feel restaurant-level.
